item.title: Beogram 4000: Installation of a Neutrik Gold Plated DIN5 Plug
item.description:
A common improvement for the Beogram 4000 is replacing the DIN5 plug with a gold-plated version. The older plugs, often corroded, benefit from the upgrade. This particular Beogram 4000 was no exception. Here’s a comparison of the old plug and the new, gleaming Neutrik plug (Newark 27B4483): The old plug was removed, and the cable was prepped for the new plug. Stripping the outer insulation to this length works well:..
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/beogram-4000-installation-of-a-neutrik-gold-plated-din5-plug/

item.title: Beogram 4002: Final Tasks, Adjustments & Playing Records
item.description:
The final steps of a Beogram 4002 Type 5513 restoration project involved addressing corrosion damage and replacing the 5-pin DIN phono plug. Using a helpful audio path diagram, continuity checks were performed from the cartridge connector to ensure proper signal flow. The replacement phono plug, a REAN model with gold contact pins, was installed, though the tight fit of the rubber boot on the cable posed a minor challenge. As an improvement, a grounding switch was added to the output board, eliminating the need for an external grounding wire...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/beogram-4002-final-tasks-adjustments-playing-records/

item.title: Beogram 4002: New Project From Houston
item.description:
My next project takes me away from Beomaster restorations and back to Beogram turntables. It’s great to work on both, so I’m excited regardless. A gentleman from Houston entrusted me with two Beogram 4002 Type 5513 turntables he acquired some years ago. As time took its toll, they stopped functioning properly.Â Like many Beogram 4002 owners, he realized he missed listening to his vinyl records and decided to have them restored...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/beogram-4002-new-project-from-houston/
